Uses of Interface
edu.rit.swing.Displayable

Packages that use Displayable
edu.rit.draw Package edu.rit.draw contains classes and programs for drawing diagrams and slides of all kinds. 
edu.rit.image Package edu.rit.image contains components for treating matrices as images, where each element of the matrix corresponds to one pixel of the image. 
edu.rit.numeric.plot Package edu.rit.numeric.plot provides classes and interfaces for plotting data. 
edu.rit.numeric.plot.impl Package edu.rit.numeric.plot.impl provides low-level implementation classes for the high-level plotting classes in package edu.rit.numeric.plot. 
edu.rit.swing Package edu.rit.swing contains GUI components designed to work with Java Swing. 
 

Uses of Displayable in edu.rit.draw
 

Classes in edu.rit.draw that implement Displayable
 class Drawing
          Class Drawing provides a drawing.
 

Uses of Displayable in edu.rit.image
 

Methods in edu.rit.image that return Displayable

          Obtain a Displayable object with which to display this image in a Swing UI.
abstract  Displayable PJGImage.getDisplayable()
          Obtain a Displayable object with which to display this image in a Swing UI.
 Displayable BaseColorImage.getDisplayable()
          Obtain a Displayable object with which to display this image in a Swing UI.
 

Uses of Displayable in edu.rit.numeric.plot
 

Classes in edu.rit.numeric.plot that implement Displayable
 class Plot
          Class Plot is a class for creating and displaying a plot.
 

Uses of Displayable in edu.rit.numeric.plot.impl
 

Classes in edu.rit.numeric.plot.impl that implement Displayable
 class XYPlot
          Class XYPlot provides an XY plot.
 

Uses of Displayable in edu.rit.swing
 

Subinterfaces of Displayable in edu.rit.swing
 interface Viewable
          Interface Viewable specifies the interface for an object that can be viewed on the screen using the View program.
 

Classes in edu.rit.swing that implement Displayable
 class DisplayableList
          Class DisplayableList provides an object that combines a list of separate Displayable objects into a single displayable object.
 

Methods in edu.rit.swing that return Displayable
 Displayable DisplayablePanel.display()
          Obtain this displayable panel's displayable object.
 

Methods in edu.rit.swing with parameters of type Displayable
 void DisplayableList.add(Displayable theDisplayable)
          Add the given displayable object to the end of this displayable list.
 void DisplayableFrame.display(Displayable theDisplayable)
          Tell this displayable object viewer to display the given displayable object.
 void DisplayablePanel.display(Displayable theDisplayable)
          Tell this displayable panel to display the given displayable object.
static void DisplayableIO.writeBilevelPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile)
          Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a bilevel (black and white) image.
static void DisplayableIO.writeBilevelPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile, double theScale)
          Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a bilevel (black and white) image with the given scale factor.
static void DisplayableIO.writeColorPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile)
          Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a 24-bit color image.
static void DisplayableIO.writeColorPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile, double theScale)
          Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a 24-bit color image with the given scale factor.
static void DisplayableIO.writeGrayscalePNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile)
          Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a grayscale image.
static void DisplayableIO.writeGrayscalePNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile, double theScale)
          Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a grayscale image with the given scale factor.
static void DisplayableIO.writePostScriptFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile)
          Write the given displayable object to a PostScript file.
